messages.message:
Hey, when searching for content in documents while building projects it would be really useful if the ctrl-f functionality could be improved. At the moment, when I ctrl-f a term I can find it in the OCR view, but have no way of figuring out where this corresponding data is within the pdf view to debug why it may/may not be being picked out.

I'd like a 'Go to section in PDF' button that drags me to the equivalent text section the PDF when browsing the OCR view. They have this functionality in Overleaf when writing Latex and its really useful
Note: even if source tracking works 100%, this is still useful because often you ctrl-f to check important key-value pairs to understand if there is missing extracted information

I often do the same thing to check extracted values vs whatâ€™s in the document

@Weiming Wu do you know why we show the OCR text all in 1 page and not page-by-page so that we can synchronize scrolling across the image and text views?
hasn't it always been the case that the OCR text is always in one page?

@Serena It's all in one page because the OCR text on the backend is stored all in one page (look at any of the `/load_record` endpoint responses for the `text` field. I think that this was the case for AI Hub ever since the beginning, but not the case for Instabase classic.
I see, yeah I remember now we had this same conversation a while back
